name: S135964540100009X-gr1.jpg
caption: TEM micrographs to show microstructures at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.60 0.55 −0.56)/[−0.79 −0.31 0.53]. It is seen that the grain is subdivided by some long straight boundaries into some large regions (a). The subgrains can be observed in the region (marked A) near the grain boundary (b). The dislocation boundaries just start to form in the region (marked B) (c). A set of dislocation boundaries is formed along the direction of −51° to RD in the region (marked F) (d).
label: Fig. 1

name: S135964540100009X-gr2.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show dislocation structures at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.51 0.86 0.03)/[−0.81 −0.47 −0.34]. No boundaries are found.
label: Fig. 2

name: S135964540100009X-gr3.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show microstructures at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(0.93 −0.34 0.03)/[0.30 0.77 −0.56]. The dislocation boundaries just start to form.
label: Fig. 3

name: S135964540100009X-gr4.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show a set of boundaries at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(0.08 0.62 −0.79)/[−0.91 −0.28 −0.31].
label: Fig. 4

name: S135964540100009X-gr5.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show two sets of boundaries at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.63 0.76 −0.16)/[−0.75 −0.65 −0.11].
label: Fig. 5

name: S135964540100009X-gr6.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show dislocation structures at a strain of 0.14. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.25 0.95 −0.18)/[−0.97 −0.25 0.01].
label: Fig. 6

name: S135964540100009X-gr7.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show the elongated cell structures at a strain of 0.53. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.74 0.67 −0.04)/[−0.56 −0.58 0.58].
label: Fig. 7

name: S135964540100009X-gr8.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show the approximately square cell structures at a strain of 0.53. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(0.15 0.75 −0.64)/[−0.95 0.30 0.12].
label: Fig. 8

name: S135964540100009X-gr9.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show the subgrain structures at a strain of 0.53. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(−0.90 0.35 −0.23)/[−0.42 −0.69 0.58].
label: Fig. 9

name: S135964540100009X-gr10.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show microstructures composed of large cells and small cells at a strain of 0.53. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(0.99 0.05 0.09)/[−0.07 0.98 0.19].
label: Fig. 10

name: S135964540100009X-gr11.jpg
caption: TEM micrograph to show the subgrain structures at a strain of 1.52. The grain orientation is ND/RD=(0.08 0.88 −0.47)/[−0.98 0.17 0.13].
label: Fig. 11

name: S135964540100009X-gr12.jpg
caption: Relationship between the type of microstructure and grain orientation at strains of 0.14 and 0.53 in an orientation distribution figure.
label: Fig. 12

name: S135964540100009X-gr13.jpg
caption: Histogram of the macroscopic orientation of dislocation boundaries to RD on the longitudinal section at strains of 0.14 and 0.53.
label: Fig. 13

name: S135964540100009X-gr14.jpg
caption: Histograms of the misorientation angles across all boundaries for the Type A microstructure at strains of (a) 0.14, (b) 0.53, (c) 1.52, and (d) 2.49.
label: Fig. 14

name: S135964540100009X-gr15.jpg
caption: Distributions of misorientation angles across all boundaries at different strains for the Type A microstructure. With increasing strain, the maximum frequency of misorientation angles decreases, the corresponding orientation widens and the maximum misorientation angle increases.
label: Fig. 15

name: S135964540100009X-gr16.jpg
caption: Histograms of misorientation angles across the boundary IIs for the Type AI microstructure at strains of (a) 0.14 and (c) 0.53, across the boundary IIs for the Type AII microstructures at strains of (b) 0.14 and (d) 0.53, and across subgrain boundaries (e) at a strain of 0.53.
label: Fig. 16

name: S135964540100009X-gr17.jpg
caption: The average misorientation angle across all boundaries in grains with different orientations versus strain. The Type C microstructure has the highest misorientation angle at a strain of 0.52. The misorientation angle across boundaries for the Type B microstructure is similar to that for the Type A microstructure.
label: Fig. 17

name: S135964540100009X-gr18.jpg
caption: Histograms of misorientation angles across all boundaries for the Type B microstructure at a strain of 0.14.
label: Fig. 18

name: S135964540100009X-gr19.jpg
caption: Histograms of the misorientation angles across boundaries (a) in the cell blocks, (b) between cell blocks and large cells, and (c) in the grains for the Type C microstructure at a strain of 0.53.
label: Fig. 19

name: S135964540100009X-gr20.jpg
caption: Histograms of (a) boundary distance for the Type A microstructure and (b)–(d) cell size for the Type B microstructure at a strain of 0.14.
label: Fig. 20

name: S135964540100009X-gr21.jpg
caption: Histograms of (a)–(c) elongated cell size, (d)–(f) square cell size, and (g)–(i) subgrain size for the Type A microstructure at a strain of 0.53.
label: Fig. 21

name: S135964540100009X-gr22.jpg
caption: Histograms of (a)–(c) small cell size and (d)–(f) large cell size for the Type C microstructure at a strain of 0.53.
label: Fig. 22

name: S135964540100009X-gr23.jpg
caption: Histograms of subgrain size for the Type A microstructure at strains of (a)–(c) 1.52 and (d)–(f) 2.49.
label: Fig. 23

name: S135964540100009X-gr24.jpg
caption: The width and length of cells or subgrains (a) and the ratio of length to width (b) versus strain. At a strain of 0.14, the data present the distance of boundaries for the Type A Microstructure.
label: Fig. 24

name: S135964540100009X-gr25.jpg
caption: Schematic drawing of grain subdivision for (a) and (b) the Type A microstructure, (c) the Type B microstructure, and (d) the Type C microstructure.
label: Fig. 25

name: S135964540100009X-gr26.jpg
caption: Division of Euler space based the characteristics of microstructures and textures. AI, the brass orientation region; AII, the copper orientation region; B, the rotated Goss orientation region; C, the cube orientation region; D, the Goss orientation region; E, the rotated cube orientation region.
label: Fig. 26
